availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William J. Lunsford (Fulton County, KY, farmer and prov govt)

body.p: Fulton County, Kentucky, farmer and provisional government convention member. North Carolina native. Married to Mary J. Lunsford. Father of Louis C. Lunsford, Metcalf Lunsford, Mary A. Lunsford, and James P. Lunsford. Farmer in Montgomery County, Tennessee in 1850. Owned twenty-three enslaved persons in Montgomery County, Tennessee in 1850. Farmer in Fulton County in 1860. Owned twenty-one enslaved persons in Montgomery County, Tennessee in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Montgomery County, p. 193B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Tennessee, Montgomery County, p. 838.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, p. 467.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, p. 5A.
Find A Grave, "William J. Lunsford (Jan. 1, 1822-1864)," Memorial #126053330, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/126053330 (accessed May 5, 2020).
